basics.name: Zhiheng Jiang
basics.label: Incoming CSE freshman at UCLA
basics.summary: Excited about complex systems and machine learning.

work.name: Structures-Computer Interaction Lab at UCLA
work.summary: Working under Prof. M. Khalid Jawed to investigate using LLMs for Robotics
highlights: Developing software to integrate Robot Operating System (ROS) with Anthropic’s Claude LLM

work.name: Institute of High Performance Computing - Agency for Science, Techology and Research, Singapore
work.summary: Conducted social network analysis research under the mentorship of Dr Hoai Nguyen Huynh
highlights: Developed research methodology to analyze metal music genre community structure
Introduced Natural Language Processing and Text Mining techniques to retrieve information from reviews
Published paper as First Author in Springer Social Network Analysis and Mining journal
Presented at the Singapore Science and Engineering Fair (Gold Award)

work.name: School of Physical and Mathematical Sciences - Nanyang Technogical University, Singapore
work.summary: Conducted Natural Language Processing research under Assoc Prof Cheong Siew Ann
highlights: Developed research methodology to summarize narratives (eg. Sherlock Holmes) into an agency network
Presented paper at Singapore Youth Science Conference (Distinction) and International Science Youth Forum
Presented poster at the Singapore Science and Engineering Fair (Finalist)

courses: Infocomm and Robotics Club (Machine Learning & Competitive Programming Divisions)

awards.title: Today I Learnt (TIL) Artificial Intelligence Competition, Advanced Category Champion
awards.awarder: Defence Science and Technology Agency, Singapore
awards.summary: Achieved the Champion Award in the Advanced Category, competing with university students in Singapore.

awards.title: International Mathematical Modelling Challenge, Outstanding Award (Top 2 International)
awards.awarder: Defence Science and Technology Agency, Singapore
awards.summary: Determined the Greatest of All Time in individual and team sports, using mathematical modelling.

awards.title: Singapore Science and Engineering Fair, Gold Award
awards.awarder: Science Centre Singapore and Ministry of Education Singapore
awards.summary: I obtained the Gold Award at SSEF with my individual project, Unveiling music genre structure through common-interest communities.

awards.title: Today I Learnt (TIL) Artificial Intelligence Competition, Pre-tertiary Team Champion
awards.awarder: Defence Science and Technology Agency, Singapore
awards.summary: Emerged as the top team amongst pre-tertiary teams (Junior College, Polytechnics and ITEs) in Singapore.

awards.title: Shopee Code League - Top 15
awards.summary: Solved a series of algorithmic and machine learning tasks. Emerged Top 15 teams regionally (South-east Asia).

awards.title: National Olympiad in Informatics - Silver
awards.summary: Top 30 in Competitive Programming in Singapore, for Secondary and Pre-tertiary students.

publications.name: Unveiling Music Genre Structure through Common-Interest Communities
publications.publisher: Springer Social Network Analysis and Mining, Volume 12, Article 35
publications.summary: Using a dataset of more than 90,000 metal music reviews written by over 9000 users in a period of 15 years, we analyse the genre structure of metal music with the aid of review text information.

publications.name: Who is the Greatest? Maradona or Pelé? Biles or Khorkina?
publications.summary: Determined the Greatest of All Time in individual and team sports, using mathematical modelling.

publications.name: Flash Sale
publications.summary: We developed objective function to estimate the “destructiveness” of a particular arrangement of goods, when there are many customers during a flash sale. We also used a Genetic Algorithm to optimize the position of goods on shelves in a store during flash sale, to minimize possible damage.
